decision_conditions: The proposed variation of the S106 Agreement would fail to provide contributions towards the improvement of services and facilities as a consequence of demands created by the proposed development (in respect of education, health facilities, public realm, open space improvement, library improvements, construction and employment training). The proposal therefore conflicts with Policy 8.2 of the London Plan (March 2016) and Policy R17 of the adopted Hillingdon Local Plan - Part Two: Saved Unitary Development Plan Policies (November 2012) and the Council's Planning Obligations SPG.

In the absence of a completed Deed of Variation/S106 Agreement, there is no mechanism in place at this stage to secure the delivery of any affordable housing on site and therefore, the scheme fails to accord with Policy 3.12 of the London Plan (March 2016) and Policy H2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part One - Strategic Policies (November 2012).
description:
Variation of S106 Agreement associated with planning permission Ref: 8218/APP/2011/1853 dated 12/6/13 (Redevelopment of Norwich Union House to erect a 9 storey building comprising retail floorspace at ground floor level and 8 storeys of residential units (37 units) with associated gym, access and parking arrangements) seeking a refund of:
- Affordable housing contribution (One hundred and sixty-one thousand, seven hundred and twenty-nine pounds and sixty pence)
- Construction training contribution (Twenty nine thousand and seventy-four pounds and eighty-five pence)
- Education contribution (One hundred and nine thousand, one hundred and ninety pounds)
- Health contribution (Fourteen thousand, seven hundred and sixteen ponds and twenty three pence)
- Library contribution (One thousand, five hundred and sixty-two pounds and sixteen pence)
- Open Space contribution (Fifty thousand pounds)
